page.title: 01Meeting of Tummel and Garry
page.content: This is an area of steep sided, wooded river valleys of great scenic and recreational value. Lying on the main Perth-Inverness Road, access is easy and there are many popular way-marked paths in the forest. There is abundant wildlife including buzzards, roe deer, red squirrels and salmon. There are no villages of any size although a caravan site has a considerable summer population. Within the block are also a hydro-electric power station, a freshwater fisheries laboratory and an outdoor centre for school children from the Glasgow area.
